work.name: International Computer Science Institute
work.summary: Developed efficient algorithms for computing 2-parameter absolute persistence homology and apply to graph classification tasks
highlights: C++, Python, Pybind11, CMake, Graph Classification

work.name: NSF-Mathematical Sciences Graduate Internship
work.summary: Developed faster topological optimization heuristics in Pytorch

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Accelerating iterated persistent homology computations with warm starts
publications.publisher: Yuan Luo and Bradley J. Nelson
publications.summary: Developed algorithms to accelerate persistent homology computations based on updating associated matrix factorizations

publications.name: Topology-Preserving Dimensionality Reduction via Interleaving Optimization
publications.publisher: Bradley J. Nelson and Yuan Luo
publications.summary: Developed a topological type-I/II error to identify the correspondence between original and projected datasets

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
